griffon.core.formatters

Interface Formatter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of instances this Formatter can handle.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFormatter, BigDecimalFormatter, BigIntegerFormatter, BooleanFormatter, ByteFormatter, CalendarFormatter, ColorFormatter, ColorFormatter, ColorFormatter, DateFormatter, DoubleFormatter, FloatFormatter, IntegerFormatter, LongFormatter, ShortFormatter

    public interface Formatter<T>

    Strategy for parsing and formatting instances from and to their literal representation

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Andres Almiray

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String format(T obj)
      Formats an instance into its literal representation.
      T parse(String str)
      Parses a literal representation into an instance of type T.

    • Method Detail

      • format

        @Nullable
String format(@Nullable
                     T obj)

        Formats an instance into its literal representation.

        The resulting String may be set as an argument to parse(java.lang.String) resulting in a similar instance as the input.

        Parameters:
        obj - the instance to be formatted
        Returns:
        A String representing the instance's state.

      • parse

        @Nullable
T parse(@Nullable
               String str)
        throws ParseException

        Parses a literal representation into an instance of type T.

        The resulting instance T may be set as an argument to format(T) resulting in an equal String as the input.

        Parameters:
        str - the String to be parsed
        Returns:
        an instance of type T whose state is initialized given the parameters of the input String.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the String cannot be parsed.
